subject: Technology
title: Pong: The Game That Started It All
description: A quick win: understand Pong: The Game That Started It All.

hook.text: In 1972, a simple game about bouncing a dot between two paddles launched a global industry.

buildup.text: Atari installed the first Pong machine in a bar. The next morning the bar called: it was broken.

discovery.text: It wasn't broken. The coin slot was so full of quarters it had jammed. People couldn't stop playing.

twist.text: Pong wasn't the first video game ever made. But it was the first one regular people actually wanted to play.

climax.text: Within two years, Pong clones appeared everywhere. The video game arcade industry was born.

punchline.text: A jammed coin slot proved people would pay to play games.

quiz.question: Why did the first Pong machine appear to break?
options: The coin slot was overflowing with quarters
